intro: Hibiscus grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered hibiscus, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep red, often with a yellow throat. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces蒴果 (capsular fruits) that split open to release seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular ornamental plant. Hibiscus grandiflorus is also valued for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of natural dyes.
